params.fq: ((product:Ambari AND release:2.2.2.0) OR (product:Data Platform AND release:2.4.2.0))

title: Resolving Ambari Install and Setup Problems
IntegrationTestIngestWithACL (Hortonworks Data Platform Apache HBase Java API Reference)

text: 1.1. Setup HDFS Proxy User To set up an HDFS proxy user for the Ambari Server daemon account, you
need to configure the proxy user in the HDFS configuration. This configuration is determined
, you set up an HDFS proxy user for root with the following: In Ambari Web, browse to Services > HDFS
1.1. Setup HDFS Proxy User To set up an HDFS proxy user for the Ambari Server daemon account, you
need to configure the proxy user in the HDFS configuration. This configuration is determined
, you set up an HDFS proxy user for root with the following: In Ambari Web, browse to Services > HDFS
1.2. Setup HDFS User Directory The Hive View stores user metadata in HDFS. By default, the location
in HDFS for this metadata is /user/${username} where ${username} is the username of the currently logged
for getting started with Ambari, the /user/admin folder needs to be created in HDFS. Therefore, be sure
1.3. Setup HDFS User Directory The Hive View stores user metadata in HDFS. By default, the location
in HDFS for this metadata is /user/${username} where ${username} is the username of the currently logged
for getting started with Ambari, the /user/admin folder needs to be created in HDFS. Therefore, be sure
2. Resolving Ambari Install and Setup Problems Try the recommended solution for each
to misconfiguration or other setup errors. Use the left navigation bar to go back to the appropriate screen
information, then make any necessary changes. 2.5. Problem: HDFS Smoke Test Fails If your Data
IntegrationTestIngestWithACL (Hortonworks Data Platform Apache HBase Java API Reference) Java
| Constr | Method Detail: Field | Constr | Method org.apache.hadoop.hbase Class IntegrationTestIngestWithACL
.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestBase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestIngest org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestIngestWithACL
1.2. Setup WebHCat Proxy User You must set up an HDFS proxy user for WebHCat and a WebHCat proxy
user for the Ambari Server daemon account. To setup the HDFS proxy user for WebHCat : In Ambari Web
, browse to Services > HDFS > Configs. Under the Advanced tab, navigate to the Custom core-site section
2.3. Kerberos Setup for Hive Views To set up basic Kerberos for views, see "Set Up Kerberos
requires the following additional settings: Table 8.4. Kerberos Settings for Hive Views Property Value WebHDFS
2.3. Kerberos Setup for Pig Views To set up basic Kerberos for views, see "Set Up Kerberos
requires that WebHDFS Authentication be set to auth=KERBEROS;proxyuser= For example
4.2.1. Launching the Kerberos Wizard (Automated Setup) Be sure you have Installed and Configured
name string. For example, if your cluster is named HDP and your realm is EXAMPLE.COM, the hdfs
principal will be created as hdfs-HDP@EXAMPLE.COM. Confirm your configuration. You can optionally download
